generalData.value: Air superiority fighter, capable of air-to-air and air-to-ground missions
Air-to-air missiles (AIM-7, AIM-120, AIM-9), air-to-ground bombs and missiles, 20mm M61 Vulcan cannon
Length: 63 ft, 9 in (19.43 m), Span: 42 ft, 10 in (13.05 m)

weftDescription.value: Mid-mounted, swept-back wings with square tips and a slight dihedral.
Two turbofan engines with afterburners, mounted internally at the rear of the fuselage, with visible nozzles extending beyond the fuselage.

Long and sleek with a pointed nose. The cockpit is located forward of the wings, providing the pilot with excellent visibility. The fuselage has a distinctive wedge-shaped design, with twin intakes under the wings for engine air supply.

Twin vertical stabilizers mounted outward on either side of the engine exhausts, with low-mounted horizontal stabilizers. The twin-tail configuration enhances maneuverability and control, contributing to the aircraft’s air superiority role. “Shark Tooth” on stabilizer.

generalData.value: Multi-role fighter jet for air-to-air combat and air-to-ground attack missions
Air-to-air missiles (AIM-9, AIM-120), air-to-ground bombs (GBU, JDAM), 20mm M61 Vulcan cannon
Length: 49 ft 5 in (15.06 m), Span: 32 ft 8 in (9.96 m)

weftDescription.value: Mid-mounted swept-back wings with sharp leading edges and clipped tips providing excellent maneuverability at high speeds.
Single turbofan engine with afterburner mounted inside the fuselage with an exhaust nozzle extending slightly beyond the rear.

Sleek aerodynamically optimized fuselage with a bubble canopy for enhanced pilot visibility. The nose is sharp and pointed, housing advanced radar systems. The body tapers towards the tail providing a streamlined appearance.

Single vertical stabilizer with twin low-mounted horizontal stabilizers. The vertical stabilizer is large and canted slightly backwards while the horizontal stabilizers are broad and positioned towards the rear of the fuselage.

generalData.value: One (pilot) or two (pilot and weapons systems officer, depending on variant)
Multi-role fighter jet for air-to-air combat and air-to-ground attack missions
Air-to-air missiles (AIM-9, AIM-120), air-to-ground bombs and missiles (GBU, JDAM), 20mm M61 Vulcan cannon
Length: 56 ft (17.1 m), Span: 40 ft 4 in (12.3 m)

weftDescription.value: Mid-mounted swept-back wings with square tips and outward-angled leading edges. The wings are equipped with leading-edge extensions (LEX) that improve maneuverability and stability during high-angle-of-attack maneuvers.
Two turbofan engines with afterburners mounted internally at the rear of the fuselage with twin exhaust nozzles extending slightly beyond the fuselage.

Sleek and aerodynamic with a pointed nose housing radar and avionics. The cockpit is positioned forward of the wings and features a bubble canopy for excellent pilot visibility. The fuselage tapers toward the rear, providing a streamlined design for high-speed performance.

Twin vertical stabilizers mounted outward on either side of the exhausts with two low-mounted horizontal stabilizers. The twin-tail configuration offers enhanced control and stability during air combat maneuvers.

generalData.value: Air superiority stealth fighter with advanced air-to-air and air-to-ground capabilities
Air-to-air missiles (AIM-9, AIM-120), air-to-ground bombs (JDAM, SDB), 20mm M61 Vulcan cannon
Length: 62 ft 1 in (18.9 m), Span: 44 ft 6 in (13.6 m)

weftDescription.value: Mid-mounted trapezoidal wings with sharp clipped tips and minimal dihedral. The wings are designed for stealth and high maneuverability at high speeds.
Two turbofan engines with afterburners and thrust vectoring nozzles mounted internally at the rear of the fuselage. The exhaust nozzles are flat and wide, contributing to the stealth profile.

Sleek angular fuselage with a pointed nose and blended body contours designed for low radar visibility. The cockpit is located forward of the wings and features a bubble canopy that provides excellent visibility. The overall shape of the fuselage is optimized for stealth, with internal weapons bays to reduce radar signature.
Twin vertical stabilizers that are canted outward along with large horizontal stabilizers positioned near the tail, contributing to the aircraft's agility and control during high-speed maneuvers.

generalData.value: Six (pilot, co-pilot, navigator, flight engineer, loadmaster, communications officer)

weftDescription.value: High-mounted swept-back wings with slight taper and broad square tips.
Four turbofan engines mounted under the wings with large nacelles extending forward of the wings' leading edges.

Extremely large and wide fuselage with a rounded nose, which opens upwards for cargo loading. The fuselage is designed to carry oversized cargo and has a double-deck structure with the cockpit and crew positioned in the upper section.
Conventional tail with a low-mounted horizontal stabilizer.

generalData.value: Seven (pilot, co-pilot, flight engineer, loadmasters, and additional crew)

Massive long fuselage with a wide bulbous nose. The aircraft features both nose and tail loading doors for cargo, with the nose capable of tilting upward for access. The upper deck is reserved for crew and additional passengers, while the lower deck is used for cargo.
T-tail configuration with a single large vertical stabilizer and high-mounted horizontal stabilizers. This setup enhances stability and control, especially for such a large aircraft.
